data.title: Don't waste your culinary time here...
data.text: I had a less than pleasurable experience here for lunch... service was eh, food was not good (even for a diner) and atmosphere felt tired.  With all the great options in Owensboro, not going back.

data.title: Nice casual place I would recommend but there were some issues.
data.text:
I ate here on Saturday night on my way to an event the Owensboro Riverpark Center. It is a small local place that came recommended by the hotel where I was staying. It is right out of the 50’s. There is a large counter that you can sit at and booths and tables. It is not a big place but I was able to get right in without a wait. It is place you go for a sandwich or burger type of place.
The service was OK. I got waited on quickly but they messed up my order. They took my sandwich back to fix it. It came back with the same fries it left with so now I had cold fries. I was in a hurry so I dealt with it but I was not happy.
The food was OK. I would eat here again.

data.title: Disappointed
data.text: Knowing this was a locally owned restaurant, we were looking forward to trying Bee Bops. We visited on a weeknight evening. Although there was still over an hour until closing the vibe was one of "can't wait to go home." I had the basic burger and my husband had the barbecue bacon burger. We ordered onion rings as a starter. The onion rings tasted like they were frozen. They lacked flavor or seasoning in the coating. My husband's barbecue bacon burger had one spot of barbecue sauce the size of a nickel. I had to go to the counter ask for additional barbecue sauce. The buns on both sandwiches were over-sized for the burger and verged on staleness.  Both buns were served cold. The restaurant is billed as a 50's style diner. The decor fit the 50's period, but the food had none of the 50's flat top grill flavor. We seldom saw our server. Our bill had no prices or total, only a hand written listing of the items we ordered. When we went to the cashier to pay our bill we had to wait while he finished looking at his cell phone before he took our money. While he took our money he had an ongoing conversation with another employee.  Perhaps our experience would have been different if we visited for lunch. In their downtown location, lunch is probably their busiest part of the day. Although we make a point of supporting locally owned businesses, sadly this is one we will not be visiting again.

data.title: Good sandwiches
data.text: I really like the deli meat sandwiches at Bee Bops.  It's all high quality meats.  The homemade potato chips are really good and warm.  I think the decor is a bit hokey, but the food is good.

data.title: On our honeymoon needed lunch
data.text: My husband says the burger he got was very good. My experience not so good. I ordered a French did sandwich which was listed under favorites. My sandwich was stone cold, waitress never checked on us. Our waitress yelled over to.me from behind the counter asking what I wanted for salad dressing, I didn't realize she was speaking to me because I didn't order a salad once my husband got my attention to answer her I did. Once our.food arrived his coleslaw was missing... she then realized she messed up and took my salad away from the table and brought his coleslaw that was more like a pepper soup. .... we will not be returning

data.title: Great food and Service
data.text: Love Bee Bops!! Love the food and the staff!! Reuben is the best in town!! Always a great experience! !

data.title: Convenient Place to Eat Downtown
data.text: If you are looking to step back in time, then Bee Bops is the place for you. The food is decent, prices are fair, and they provide good customer service. I like the placement of Bee Bops because it's close to the river and provides a nice place to walk at nighttime and during Friday after Five.

data.title: Not so good.
data.text: Everyone that we talked with suggested us eating here. The food was just so so. The milk shake was average and the service was awful. There was only two other people there and it took us almost forty- five minutes to get our food. The server was the cook and stayed on his cell phone the whole time and never returned to asked if we wanted anything else. We even had to go to the counter to get our bill and to check out. We will never go again.

data.title: Good Value
data.text:
We were in Owensboro with friends for Friday After Five on the waterfront. (If you haven't checked out the waterfront scene in Owensboro on Fridays in the summer you're missing a great experience.)

We stopped in at Bee Bops around 6:30 and the place was hoppin' but we only waited a minute or two for a booth. Our server was perky and attentive and understood the menu well.

Between the four of us we had salads, burgers, and wraps. The food was good, not great but the prices were very reasonably. We split an appetizer, had four entrees and four drinks and still got out (with tip) for around $45. Perhaps one of the reasons that prices are low is that everything is served in paper or plastic. I doubt they have a dishwasher job at this restaurant!
Good prices, pretty good food, better than a fast food joint and convenient to the waterfront. Better and more pricier restaurants near by but a good place for families with kids. Kitschy 50s/60s dinner décor.

data.title: Mediocre...
data.text: I had just a cheeseburger dressed with fries, and I was not very impressed, especially with the price. My husband got the 3 Stooges sandwich, and he was also not very impressed. For what you get and the price you are much better off going to the Big Dipper if you're wanting burger and fries.

data.title: Good food & friendly service
data.text: Enjoyed burgers and fries with a brownie ice cream milkshake for a quick dinner.  Big hit with my 13 year old son.  Our server was sweet and helpful with her suggestions.  Fun for kids!

data.title: Yummy
data.text: This is downtown, The food was EXCELLENT and the waiters were great.  Fast service and very cozy (we ate outside)

data.title: Always good food and awesome service.
data.text: Fried pickles, burgers, fries.  Only complaint is I can't eat it all.  Kids meals are perfect size and price.

data.title: A disappointment
data.text: Not impressed by any of the food we were served. I couldn't finish mine (chicken sandwich wrap) and my daughters' food look like something from McDonalds. It was loud and busy (I was shocked). We left feeling disappointed we had chosen to eat there.

data.title: I love this place, they make you feel like Owensboro is your hometown!!!
data.text: Their breakfast was great!!! I had a burger and fries for lunch and it was excellent. The owner came around to talk to us she spent a few minutes to get to know us and we got to know them. What a great place to visit while in Owensboro.

data.title: Good, not great, burgers
data.text:
Had a party melt and onion rings for dinner one night while in town for business. Food was good, but nothing special. Burger was a little dry for my tastes. 

Atmosphere is fun, maybe a little busy. Service was quick and friendly. 

I wouldn't avoid the place, but I wouldn't make it a destination either.

data.title: Delicious burger!
data.text: The kids had a snow day so we decided to go somewhere new.  I am glad we did my wife loved the buddy (blt), my daughter loved the nuggets, and myself and sons had burgers that rivaled the best we have ever had!  The service was awesome, the waitress spoke directly to the kids.  The price was reasonable.  All around a great lunch.

data.title: Great Downtown Stop
data.text: Great burger and fries place. E deep fried pickles are always a great add on.  A great addition to the downtown area.

data.title: Vanilla Sprite
data.text: Love the fountain sodas; brings back memories from my youth and I exclusively order a vanilla Sprite. Good hamburger sandwich and onion rings.

data.title: Employee's not trained
data.text: Went to purchase gift cards for our company luncheon and the employee working behind the counter did not know how to do gift cards and showed no signs of  figuring out other options, so I purchased gift cards a couple of business down from Bee Bops and they were glad to help me.
